topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Using the HCG Dashboard to Deploy the Denver Template

body.p: After the lifecycle manager is installed, the next task in installing the Denver topology is to deploy the HP Helion OpenStack cloud.
If you are installing the denver template, using the HCG Dashboard, follow these instructions. If you want to use the HLM CLI, see Using the CLI to Deploy the Denver Template.

section.p: HCG-Dashboard is a cloud management tool which allows users to Define, Deploy, Manage and Monitor cloud.
This tool facilitates users to provide and validate cloud definitions required define a cloud through web interface.

body.section:
Deploying the cloudAfter you enter all necessary inputs to your cloud, you will be redirected to a page where you can see description and current status of your cloud along with a few other options:
You can click on "DEPLOY" button (as seen in above page) to start/return to a deploy workflow:
"Deploy Workflow" consists of four phases - provision, generate, netinit and deploy
At the top you will see the name of your cloud and current status - "DEFINED" | "PROVISIONED" | "GENERATED" | "NETINITIALIZED" | "DEPLOYED"Depending on the status, marker on the wizard will move by default to a process which was completed successfully
To execute a particular process, you can navigate (or directly click) on corresponding step and click "Run"
Note: you will not be able to navigate to step "n" if step "n-1" is not completedOnce you hit the "Run" button, you will see your process being executed as shown below:
The process runs asynchronously in background.
